results.title: Effects of systemic medication on root resorption associated with orthodontic tooth movement: a systematic review of animal studies.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Twenty-one studies were finally identified, most of which at unclear risk of bias. @<m>DISEASE_Root_Resorption</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012391 @@@Root resorption@@@ was shown to increase in @CHEMICAL_Ascorbic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001205 @@@Vitamin C@@@ treated animals in comparison with the control group, whereas a comparative decrease was noted after the administration of the @CHEMICAL_Alendronate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019386 @@@alendronate@@@, @CHEMICAL_Ibuprofen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007052 @@@ibuprofen@@@, @CHEMICAL_Growth_Hormone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013006 @@@growth hormone@@@, low doses of @CHEMICAL_Meloxicam @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077239 @@@meloxicam@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Lithium_Chloride @CHEMICAL_MESH:D018021 @@@lithium chloride@@@ and @CHEMICAL_strontium_ranelate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C081587 @@@strontium ranelate@@@.

citations.NLM: Makrygiannakis MA, Kaklamanos EG, Athanasiou AE. Effects of systemic medication on root resorption associated with orthodontic tooth movement: a systematic review of animal studies. Eur J Orthod. 2019 Aug 8;41(4):346-359. PMID: 29992228
